alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 12 at 9:19AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Tanana River at Manley Hot Springs * WHEN...Through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Ice jam flooding is possible and has a high uncertainty. Impacts could range between localized high water or significant flooding. Large chunks of ice could push overbank along the Tanana River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ice shifted and moved at Manley Hot Springs on Thursday afternoon and water levels continue to rise. River observer reports and satellite imagery indicate somewhat hard and intact ice is still in place on the Tanana River below Manley Hot Springs and downriver to the Yukon River. There is the possibility of ice jams forming as the breakup front moves past a known jam point about 12 miles below Manley Hot Springs. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana River at Manley Hot Springs stay alert and be prepared to take action. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare for possible flooding.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
